alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:39PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Johnson County through 1015 PM MDT... At 938 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barnum, or 12 miles west of Kaycee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kaycee. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 244 and 264. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Southeast Johnson County
